description: Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/annotations
name: applications.<name>.resources.applicationSets.<name>.spec.template.metadata.annotations

description:
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.

Populated by the system. Read-only. Null for lists. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata
name: applications.<name>.resources.applicationSets.<name>.spec.template.metadata.creationTimestamp

description: Number of seconds allowed for this object to gracefully terminate before it will be removed from the system. Only set when deletionTimestamp is also set. May only be shortened. Read-only.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applicationSets.<name>.spec.template.metadata.deletionGracePeriodSeconds

description:
DeletionTimestamp is RFC 3339 date and time at which this resource will be deleted. This field is set by the server when a graceful deletion is requested by the user, and is not directly settable by a client. The resource is expected to be deleted (no longer visible from resource lists, and not reachable by name) after the time in this field, once the finalizers list is empty. As long as the finalizers list contains items, deletion is blocked. Once the deletionTimestamp is set, this value may not be unset or be set further into the future, although it may be shortened or the resource may be deleted prior to this time. For example, a user may request that a pod is deleted in 30 seconds. The Kubelet will react by sending a graceful termination signal to the containers in the pod. After that 30 seconds, the Kubelet will send a hard termination signal (SIGKILL) to the container and after cleanup, remove the pod from the API. In the presence of network partitions, this object may still exist after this timestamp, until an administrator or automated process can determine the resource is fully terminated. If not set, graceful deletion of the object has not been requested.

Populated by the system when a graceful deletion is requested. Read-only. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata
name: applications.<name>.resources.applicationSets.<name>.spec.template.metadata.deletionTimestamp

description: Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries in this list can only be removed. Finalizers may be processed and removed in any order. Order is NOT enforced because it introduces significant risk of stuck finalizers. finalizers is a shared field, any actor with permission can reorder it. If the finalizer list is processed in order, then this can lead to a situation in which the component responsible for the first finalizer in the list is waiting for a signal (field value, external system, or other) produced by a component responsible for a finalizer later in the list, resulting in a deadlock. Without enforced ordering finalizers are free to order amongst themselves and are not vulnerable to ordering changes in the list.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applicationSets.<name>.spec.template.metadata.finalizers

description:
GenerateName is an optional prefix, used by the server, to generate a unique name ONLY IF the Name field has not been provided. If this field is used, the name returned to the client will be different than the name passed. This value will also be combined with a unique suffix. The provided value has the same validation rules as the Name field, and may be truncated by the length of the suffix required to make the value unique on the server.

If this field is specified and the generated name exists, the server will return a 409.

Applied only if Name is not specified. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#idempotency
name: applications.<name>.resources.applicationSets.<name>.spec.template.metadata.generateName

description: A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state. Populated by the system. Read-only.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applicationSets.<name>.spec.template.metadata.generation

name: applications.<name>.resources.applicationSets.<name>.spec.template.metadata.labels

This is mostly for internal housekeeping, and users typically shouldn't need to set or understand this field. A workflow can be the user's name, a controller's name, or the name of a specific apply path like "ci-cd". The set of fields is always in the version that the workflow used when modifying the object.

description: Manager is an identifier of the workflow managing these fields.

description: Operation is the type of operation which lead to this ManagedFieldsEntry being created. The only valid values for this field are 'Apply' and 'Update'.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applicationSets.<name>.spec.template.metadata.managedFields.*.operation

description: Subresource is the name of the subresource used to update that object, or empty string if the object was updated through the main resource. The value of this field is used to distinguish between managers, even if they share the same name. For example, a status update will be distinct from a regular update using the same manager name. Note that the APIVersion field is not related to the Subresource field and it always corresponds to the version of the main resource.

Name is primarily intended for creation idempotence and configuration definition. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names#names

Must be a DNS_LABEL. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces

description: Operation contains information about a requested or running operation
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation

description: Info is a list of informational items for this operation
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.info

description: InitiatedBy contains information about who initiated the operations
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.initiatedBy

description: Automated is set to true if operation was initiated automatically by the application controller.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.initiatedBy.automated

description: Username contains the name of a user who started operation
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.initiatedBy.username

description: Retry controls the strategy to apply if a sync fails
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.retry

description: Backoff controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.retry.backoff

description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. "2m", "1h")
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.retry.backoff.duration

description: Factor is a factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.retry.backoff.factor

description: MaxDuration is the maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.retry.backoff.maxDuration

description: Limit is the maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.retry.limit

description: Sync contains parameters for the operation
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync

description: DryRun specifies to perform a kubectl apply --dry-run without actually performing the sync
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.dryRun

description: Manifests is an optional field that overrides sync source with a local directory for development
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.manifests

description: Prune specifies to delete resources from the cluster that are no longer tracked in git
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.prune

description: Resources describes which resources shall be part of the sync
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.resources

description: Revision is the revision (Git) or chart version (Helm) which to sync the application to If omitted, will use the revision specified in app spec.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.revision

description: Revisions is the list of revision (Git) or chart version (Helm) which to sync each source in sources field for the application to If omitted, will use the revision specified in app spec.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.revisions

description: Source overrides the source definition set in the application. This is typically set in a Rollback operation and is nil during a Sync operation
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source

description: Chart is a Helm chart name, and must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.chart

description: Directory holds path/directory specific options
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.directory

description: Exclude contains a glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.directory.exclude

description: Include contains a glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.directory.include

description: Jsonnet holds options specific to Jsonnet
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.directory.jsonnet

description: ExtVars is a list of Jsonnet External Variables
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.directory.jsonnet.extVars

description: Additional library search dirs
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.directory.jsonnet.libs

description: TLAS is a list of Jsonnet Top-level Arguments
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.directory.jsonnet.tlas

description: Recurse specifies whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.directory.recurse

description: Helm holds helm specific options
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm

description: FileParameters are file parameters to the helm template
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.fileParameters

description: Name is the name of the Helm parameter
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.fileParameters.<name>.name

description: Path is the path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.fileParameters.<name>.path

description: IgnoreMissingValueFiles prevents helm template from failing when valueFiles do not exist locally by not appending them to helm template --values
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.ignoreMissingValueFiles

description: Parameters is a list of Helm parameters which are passed to the helm template command upon manifest generation
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.parameters

description: ForceString determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.parameters.<name>.forceString

description: Name is the name of the Helm parameter
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.parameters.<name>.name

description: Value is the value for the Helm parameter
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.parameters.<name>.value

description: PassCredentials pass credentials to all domains (Helm's --pass-credentials)
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.passCredentials

description: ReleaseName is the Helm release name to use. If omitted it will use the application name
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.releaseName

description: SkipCrds skips custom resource definition installation step (Helm's --skip-crds)
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.skipCrds

description: ValuesFiles is a list of Helm value files to use when generating a template
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.valueFiles

description: Values specifies Helm values to be passed to helm template, typically defined as a block. ValuesObject takes precedence over Values, so use one or the other.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.values

description: ValuesObject specifies Helm values to be passed to helm template, defined as a map. This takes precedence over Values.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.valuesObject

description: Version is the Helm version to use for templating ("3")
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.helm.version

description: Kustomize holds kustomize specific options
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize

description: CommonAnnotations is a list of additional annotations to add to rendered manifests
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.commonAnnotations

description: CommonAnnotationsEnvsubst specifies whether to apply env variables substitution for annotation values
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.commonAnnotationsEnvsubst

description: CommonLabels is a list of additional labels to add to rendered manifests
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.commonLabels

description: Components specifies a list of kustomize components to add to the kustomization before building
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.components

description: ForceCommonAnnotations specifies whether to force applying common annotations to resources for Kustomize apps
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.forceCommonAnnotations

description: ForceCommonLabels specifies whether to force applying common labels to resources for Kustomize apps
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.forceCommonLabels

description: Images is a list of Kustomize image override specifications
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.images

description: LabelWithoutSelector specifies whether to apply common labels to resource selectors or not
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.labelWithoutSelector

description: NamePrefix is a prefix appended to resources for Kustomize apps
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.namePrefix

description: NameSuffix is a suffix appended to resources for Kustomize apps
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.nameSuffix

description: Namespace sets the namespace that Kustomize adds to all resources
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.namespace

description: Patches is a list of Kustomize patches
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.patches

description: Replicas is a list of Kustomize Replicas override specifications
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.replicas

description: Number of replicas
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.replicas.<name>.count

description: Name of Deployment or StatefulSet
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.replicas.<name>.name

description: Version controls which version of Kustomize to use for rendering manifests
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.kustomize.version

description: Path is a directory path within the Git repository, and is only valid for applications sourced from Git.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.path

description: Plugin holds config management plugin specific options
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.plugin

description: Env is a list of environment variable entries
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.plugin.env

description: Name is the name of the variable, usually expressed in uppercase
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.plugin.env.<name>.name

description: Value is the value of the variable
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.plugin.env.<name>.value

type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.plugin.parameters

description: Array is the value of an array type parameter.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.plugin.parameters.<name>.array

description: Map is the value of a map type parameter.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.plugin.parameters.<name>.map

description: Name is the name identifying a parameter.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.plugin.parameters.<name>.name

description: String_ is the value of a string type parameter.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.plugin.parameters.<name>.string

description: Ref is reference to another source within sources field. This field will not be used if used with a source tag.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.ref

description: RepoURL is the URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.repoURL

description: TargetRevision defines the revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.source.targetRevision

description: Sources overrides the source definition set in the application. This is typically set in a Rollback operation and is nil during a Sync operation
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.sources

description: Chart is a Helm chart name, and must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.sources.*.chart

description: Directory holds path/directory specific options
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.sources.*.directory

description: Exclude contains a glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.sources.*.directory.exclude

description: Include contains a glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.sources.*.directory.include

description: Jsonnet holds options specific to Jsonnet
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.sources.*.directory.jsonnet

description: ExtVars is a list of Jsonnet External Variables
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.sources.*.directory.jsonnet.extVars

description: Additional library search dirs
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.sources.*.directory.jsonnet.libs

description: TLAS is a list of Jsonnet Top-level Arguments
type: null or (attribute set of (submodule) or list of (submodule))
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.sources.*.directory.jsonnet.tlas

description: Recurse specifies whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests
name: applications.<name>.resources.applications.<name>.operation.sync.sources.*.directory.recurse
